deity.name: 1Temporary
deity.title: The Formatting Entry
entries: Paragraph 1
Paragraph 2

entries.name: Inset Title
entries: Inset P1
Inset P2

deity.name: Akadi
deity.title: Goddess of Air
entries: Akadi is as transient as the element she represents and takes little interest in mortals. The only elemental god, for reasons unknown to mortals, she keeps her place as the goddess of ephemeral things and very seldom deigns to interfere in even the grandest struggles.

deity.name: Auril
deity.title: Goddess of winter
entries: Auril is the end of all things, and she knows it. A veritable embodiment of the time when all things die and wither, Auril keeps watch over the world with a languid eye. One day all will perish. And then it shall be winter evermore.

deity.name: Eldath
deity.title: Goddess of peace
entries: To Eldath, tranquility and serenity are not just ideals, they are a way of being. As such, though her vision may be just, Eldath is hard to move to action. She watches the world of mortals, hoping that one day they will accept her and live as one.

deity.name: Kelemvor
deity.title: God of the dead
deity.symbol: Upright skeletal arm holding balanced scales
entries: Kelemvor, oddly enough, has a secondary domain. He doubles often as the God of Order, and his followers seek to ensure the natural cycle of life and death. Kelemvor wishes nothing more than mortals to live and die as they are meant to, and not to return.

deity.name: Loviatar
deity.title: Goddess of pain
entries: Loviator is the mistress of agony. She relishes in the suffering of mortals, but not their deaths. Her playthings must live, suffer, weep, and bleed upon the soil, while she, queen everlasting, watches them write in exquisite joy.

deity.name: Malar
deity.title: God of the hunt
entries: Malar is a savage and feral god, a powerful force of chaos and destruction. Malar is a bringer of brutal ends, and relishes when the mortal races kill and die in explosive confrontation. However, he is often at odds with Tempus, as he finds armies and grand strategy cowardly.

deity.name: Mielikki
deity.title: Goddess of forests
entries: Mielikki is a goddess of gentle things. Of the glint of light between the trees in the canopy. Of the birds chirping in the morning air. Of the soft trickling of water over mossy stones in winding brooks. And she will protect it.

deity.name: Mystra
deity.title: Goddess of magic
deity.symbol: Circle of seven stars, or nine stars encircling a flowing red mist, or a single star
entries: Mystra is the goddess of innovation, progress, and power. She is the patron of those who seek to further the arcane arts and push the world forward into a glorious new age. Her morality can sometimes be questionable, but she reviles misuse of magic, and the pursuits of necromancy in general.

deity.name: Pelor
deity.title: God of the Sun
entries: Pelor is a god of pure righteous power. Pelor is a bringer of life and light, and the patron of paladins and other followers of the laws of the world. Pelor believes in the power of righteousness over all else, and leads an eternal crusade against the forces of darkness.

deity.name: Sel√ªne
deity.title: Goddess of the moon
deity.symbol: Pair of eyes surrounded by seven stars
entries: Selune is the goddess of illumination, of light in the shadows, of haunting midnight rays granting light to the revelries of night. She is a goddess patron of vigilantes, heroes who stalk the night and weed out the corrupt essence of the dark. A bright, mysterious, and unforgiving mistress she.

deity.name: Sylvanus
deity.title: God of wild nature
entries: Sylvanus is not like his sister Mielikki. She is the forest. He is the uncaring, unempathetic, brutality of nature. Death is but a part of the cycle. And he relishes it.

deity.name: Shar
deity.title: Goddess of darkness and loss
deity.symbol: Black disk encircled with a border
entries: Shar takes no joy in her domain, but sees herself more as the inevitable end of all things. Darkness, she posits, was there before light, and will be there long after light dies. And when light dies, so too is all lost. For in the end, what is there but I?

deity.name: Sune
deity.title: Goddess of love and beauty
deity.symbol: Face of a beautiful red-haired woman
entries: Sune is the goddess of whirling, swirling, tempestuous emotions, a veritable maelstrom of passion and fury. She is the goddess of things both beautiful and painful, of love and heartbreak, of smiles and tears. Of beauty and of bane.

deity.name: Talos
deity.title: God of storms
deity.symbol: Three lightning bolts radiating from a central point
entries: Talos, to some, is known as the Changebringer, a powerful primordial entity of destruction and rebirth. The storms of Talos wipe the slate clean and usher in new beginnings through a torrent of rain and wind. He destroys, but only so that which has fallen can rebuild stronger than before.

deity.name: Tempus
deity.title: God of war
entries: War takes no sides. War is not evil. War is not good. War is the means to an end. The end matters not. It is a tool. And Tempus is the blacksmith. The guide. The arbitrator. The executioner.

deity.name: Tyr
deity.title: God of justice
deity.symbol: Balanced scales resting on a warhammer
entries: Justice, to some, is seen as subjective. It is based on the will of the society around it. No such thing exists to Tyr. Justice is universal and absolute. Justice is the death of all those who profane the world. Death to those who perpetrate injustice. No other end will suffice.

deity.name: The Traveler
deity.title: Deity of chaos and change
entries:
Who is the Traveler? Nobody knows! Not even he knows, really. What is the god of change? How can you quantify that which can never be the same? The traveler giggles. You check your back pocket. There is 12 gold inside. You didn't have it before. But you feel odd. You see your reflection in the water, and you have no nose. Why?
Why not?

deity.name: Corellon Larethian
deity.title: Elf deity of art and magic

deity.name: Tiamat
deity.title: Dragon goddess of evil
deity.symbol: Dragon head with five claw marks

deity.name: Raven Queen
deity.title: Goddess of death
deity.symbol: Raven's head, in profile, facing left

deity.name: Mephistopheles
deity.title: Archduke of the Inferno
deity.symbol: Crimson trident piercing a golden ring

deity.name: Bel
deity.title: The Warlord
deity.symbol: Flaming blade, implaing a mound of skulls

deity.name: Demogorgon
deity.title: Prince of Demons
deity.symbol: Serpentine forked tail, usually wrapped around a sword or staff

deity.name: Juiblex
deity.title: The Faceless Lord
deity.symbol: Rarely used, a pseudopod dripping slime

deity.name: Kostchtchie
deity.title: Prince of Wrath
deity.symbol: Warhammer, the head coated in frost

deity.name: Zuggtmoy
deity.title: Queen of Fungi
deity.symbol: A jawless human skull, covered in mold and fungus

deity.name: Lolth
deity.title: Queen of Spiders
deity.symbol: A spider in the center of its web

deity.name: The Queen of Chaos
deity.symbol: Sahuagin skull, imposed on a trident

deity.name: Pazuzu
deity.title: Dark Angel of the Four Winds
